thread.title: Tourism officials promote state on Neil Patrick Harris’ TV show
thread.title_full: Albuquerque Journal | Tourism officials promote state on Neil Patrick Harris’ TV show

author: Jessica Dyer / Journal Staff Writer
title: Tourism officials promote state on Neil Patrick Harris’ TV show
text:
In their latest bid to promote New Mexico, local tourism officials have turned to one of Albuquerque’s most famous sons: Neil Patrick Harris.
Actor Neil Patrick Harris
The multi-faceted Hollywood star recently gave away a trip to New Mexico to an audience member who won a trivia contest on his NBC variety show, “Best Time Ever.” It was among a series of prizes the contestant won on the Oct. 6 show — a hodgepodge that also included a trip to Aruba, a year supply of cereal and ukuleles.
Harris briefly described the trip as “a getaway to New Mexico courtesy of the Albuquerque Convention & Visitors Bureau” over a series of images, including photographs of hot-air balloons and the state tourism department’s “New Mexico True” logo.
Producers for the show contacted the state tourism department about participating, according to ACVB spokeswoman Brenna Moore. The ACVB will foot the bill for the winner’s airfare while various area hotels and attractions stepped up to cover other parts of the trip, Moore said. It was brief exposure worth an estimated $100,000 with an audience reach of 6.7 million, the show’s promotional agency told ACVB.
Moore said it made sense to advertise the state on a show hosted by Harris, an Albuquerque native.
“Absolutely, we liked the connection and wanted to support this New Mexican,” Moore said in an email.
This is a scene from the “New Mexico True” advertising campaign touting the state as a tourism destination.
